name: speciously
content:

in a way that seems to be right or true, but is really wrong or false: This inequality was speciously justified by reasoning that women had less need for education than men. He claims, perhaps speciously, that the two had a relationship. See
specious
More examplesFewer examplesNations have a history of speciously justifying invasions.Robespierre was speciously promising peace and a return of prosperity as a reward for handing him complete control of the reins of power.They argued speciously that categorizing these attacks as hate crimes actually made racism worse.
